description: Understand shapes, sizes, and the properties of space.

slides.title: What is Geometry?
slides.content:
# Earth Measure ðŸŒ

Geo (Earth) + Metron (Measure).
Study of points, lines, surfaces, and solids.

Two main types:
- **Plane Geometry**: Flat (2D).
- **Solid Geometry**: Space (3D).

slides.title: Points, Lines, Angles
slides.content:
# The Basics âœï¸

- **Point**: Location, no size.
- **Line**: Infinite length, no width.
- **Ray**: Starts point, one infinite direction.
- **Angle**: Two rays meeting at a vertex. Measured in degrees.

slides.title: Triangles
slides.content:
# Three Sides ðŸ“

Sum of angles = 180Â°.
TYPES:
- **Equilateral**: All sides/angles equal (60Â°).
- **Isosceles**: Two sides equal.
- **Scalene**: No sides equal.
- **Right**: One 90Â° angle.

slides.title: Pythagorean Theorem
slides.content:
# Right Triangle Rule ðŸ“

$$a^2 + b^2 = c^2$$

- $a, b$: Legs.
- $c$: Hypotenuse (Longest side).
- Only works for Right Triangles.
Used to find distance between points.

slides.title: Triangle Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: If legs are 3 and 4, what is the hypotenuse?

slides.title: Polygons
slides.content:
# Many Angles ðŸ›‘

Closed shapes with straight sides.
- Quadrilateral (4)
- Pentagon (5)
- Hexagon (6)
- Octagon (8)

Sum of interior angles = $(n-2) \times 180$.

slides.title: Circles
slides.content:
# Infinite Corners ðŸŸ£

Set of points equidistant from a center.
- **Radius ($r$)**: Center to edge.
- **Diameter ($d$)**: Edge to edge through center ($2r$).
- **Circumference ($C$)**: Distance around ($2\pi r$ or $\pi d$).
- **Area ($A$)**: $\pi r^2$.

slides.title: Coordinate Geometry
slides.content:
# Cartesian Plane ðŸ—ºï¸

Rene Descartes combined Algebra and Geometry.
- X-axis and Y-axis.
- Every point is $(x, y)$.
- Distance formula: $\sqrt{(x_2-x_1)^2 + (y_2-y_1)^2}$ (Just Pythagoras!).

slides.title: Slope
slides.content:
# Steepness â›·ï¸

$$m = \frac{Rise}{Run} = \frac{y_2 - y_1}{x_2 - x_1}$$

- Positive: Uphill.
- Negative: Downhill.
- Zero: Horizontal.
- Undefined: Vertical.

slides.title: Thales' Basic Proportionality
slides.content:
# Similar Shapes ðŸ“

If a line is parallel to one side of a triangle intersecting other sides, then it divides the two sides in the same ratio.
- Basis for scaling images and maps.

slides.title: Congruence vs Similarity
slides.content:
# Same vs Scaled ðŸ‘¯

- **Congruent ($\cong$)**: Exact same shape and size. (Clone).
- **Similar ($\sim$)**: Same shape, different size. (Zoom).
  - Angles are equal, sides are proportional.

slides.title: 3D Solids
slides.content:
# Volume and Surface ðŸ“¦

- **Prism**: Box ($V = l \cdot w \cdot h$).
- **Cylinder**: Can ($V = \pi r^2 h$).
- **Sphere**: Ball ($V = \frac{4}{3} \pi r^3$).
- **Surface Area**: Total area of outside skin.

slides.title: 3D Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which shape has Volume = 4/3 * pi * r-cubed?

slides.title: Transformations
slides.content:
# Moving Shapes ðŸ”„

- **Translation**: Slide.
- **Rotation**: Turn.
- **Reflection**: Flip (Mirror).
- **Dilation**: Resize.

Rigid transformations preserve size/shape (Isometric).

slides.title: Euclidean vs Non-Euclidean
slides.content:
# Curved Space ðŸª

- **Euclidean**: Flat space. Parallel lines never meet. Triangles = 180.
- **Spherical**: Globe. Parallel lines meet at poles. Triangles > 180.
- **Hyperbolic**: Saddles. Parallel lines diverge. Triangles < 180.

slides.title: Constructions
slides.content:
# Compass and Ruler ðŸ§­

Ancient Greek game.
- Draw perfect shapes using only straight edge and compass.
- No measuring numbers allowed!
- E.g., Bisecting an angle.

slides.title: Vectors
slides.content:
# Arrow Math ðŸ¹

Quantity with Magnitude (Leghth) and Direction.
- Velocity is a vector.
- Used extensively in Physics and Video Game graphics.

slides.title: Topology
slides.content:
# Rubber Geometry ðŸ©

Study of properties preserved under stretching (no tearing/gluing).
- To a topologist, a Coffee Mug = A Donut (Both have 1 hole).
- A Sphere $\neq$ A Donut.

slides.title: Geometry Summary
slides.content:
# Recap ðŸ“

- **Shapes** have rules (Angles, Sides).
- **Pythagoras** links coordinates to distance.
- **Formulas** quantify space (Area, Volume).
- From architecture to GPS, geometry maps our world.
